items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.
items.item_text: Information on Public Comments and Disability Access
items.item_text_raw: 2. Information on Public Comments and Disability Access

items.item_details:
This study session serves as an opportunity to update the Board of Trustees on the progress of Measure G-2004 and to share a framework for success for Measure G-2010.  Included in this study session is the delivery of the 2009-2010 Measure G-2004 Annual Report from the Citizens Bond Oversight Committee as well as the final draft 2025 Facilities Master Plans for Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College recommended for board approval. 
	 
Introduction (Cepeda)
	 
1.   Measure G-2004 Update
      a.   Annual Report – CBOC (Dinh; 10 minutes)
      b.   VPA (Hay/Hawk; 5 minutes)
      c.   Milpitas (Hay/Hawk; 5 minutes)
      d.   Program Progress (Hawk/Dias; 20 minutes)
	 
2.   Measure G-2004 Lessons Learned (Hawk/Kennedy; 10 minutes)
	 
3.   Measure G-2010 Framework for Success (Hawk/Kennedy;  10 minutes)
	 
4.   2025 Facility Master Plans (Kavalier/Brock/Shepley; 20 minutes)
	 
5.   Measure G-2010 Draft Project List/Process (Hawk; 15 minutes)
	 
6.   Measure G-2010 Next Steps (Hawk; 5 minutes)
	 
7.   Questions & Answers (20 minutes)
	 
	 
The CBOC annual report is available for review using the following link:
http://sjebond.maasco.com/uploads/cboc_annual_report_09-10_web.pdf
	 
	 
1/25/11 Facilities Study Session Presentation:
http://www.sjeccd.edu/aboutus/board/agendas/Documents/Facilities_Study_Session_012511.pdf

items.item_details:
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.20 submission and recommendation: Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all District assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of the full load.
	 
Article 9.20 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all Districts assigned service during the college semester for which the y are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.   
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.20 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
	 
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 6157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District  Article 15.2.1 submission and recommendation:
	 
Article 15.2.1 Full-time unit members' overload assignment  for compensation and/or overload banking shall be based on a separate contract which shall normally be limited to 6 (six) units or 40% of a full load. Exceptions to this maximum overload shall be negotiated with the Faculty Association.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 15.2.1 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Faculty personnel action as submitted.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are:   short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details: Oral reports will be given by members of the Board of Trustees.
Oral reports will be given by Chancellor Rita Cepeda.
Oral reports will be given by the college presidents.
Oral reports will be given by the constituency representatives.

Board Policy 2745 approved on January 10, 2006 established that the Board would conduct a self evaluation " at least once a year."  In addition, this policy requires that "any evaluation shall incorporate'' Board operations and Board effectiveness. The last self evaluation of the Board was conducted on May 2008. 
	 
In addition, to established Board Policy, board self evaluation is required by the Education Code, and it is one of the principle standards established by the Western Association's Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges (i.e. Standard IV.B.Ig ).
	 
There are several factors that make this board self evaluation particularly important:
	 
1. The board was not able to meet the requirements for evaluation in 2009 and 2010.
2. The recent visit of the Accrediting Commission yielded six "joint recommendations" included in the reports for both Evergreen Valley and San Jose City College.  Five of these joint recommendations focus on Board Governance.
3. The selection of a new Chancellor at the beginning of the 2010/2011 Academic Year will not permit a retrospective evaluation but will allow for prospective board direction on District Strategic Directions.
	 
Given these factors the Chancellor should work as a staff resource with a Board Committee to establish a process that is consonant with accepted practice (California Community College Trustees/CCCT or the  Association of Community College Trustees/ACCT).  This process should include the means to assess and evaluate the following:
	 
1.  Responses to Accreditation recommendations on "governance"
2.  Board operations and Board Effectiveness (BP 2745)
3.  Approval of Chancellor's Proposed District Strategic Directions
	 
The Board Committee should report to the Board on the specific process and procedures for evaluation by March 8 and present a report that summarizes the results and identifies actions that the Board may take as a result of the evaluation at its meeting of March 22.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board President appoint a committee of Board members to work with the Chancellor to develop and recommend the process and criteria for Board Evaluation by March 8, 2011.
items.item_text: Appointment of sub-committee and establishment of timeline for 2011 Board Self-Evaluation
items.item_text_raw: 1. Appointment of sub-committee and establishment of timeline for 2011 Board Self-Evaluation

items.item_details:
The 2025 Facilities Master Plans were prepared in response to the 2025 Educational Master Plans that were developed by the Colleges and approved by the Board of Trustees in July 2010.  
 
The 2025 Facilities Master Plans highlight physical changes to the Colleges that have occurred since the previous master plans and delineate proposed additional physical changes to the Colleges that may occur by the end of 2025 through implementation of these plans.  This includes buildings and facilities that will be demolished, constructed or renovated, as well as comprehensive views of circulation, way finding, landscape, and infrastructure.  These plans represent the outcome of collaborative, inclusive processes at the Colleges that were facilitated by the master planning team.
 
		Once the 2025 Facilities Master Plans are approved by the Trustees, District and College staff are free to take specific actions necessary to implement the plans, including, but not limited to, developing project lists, allocating budget resources, executing contracts and appropriating budget (with Board of Trustees approval). The first step in this process will be for the District to begin the selection of a CEQA consultant to develop Environmental Impact Reports (EIR) for each College.  These EIRs will be approved by the Board of Trustees before any projects are constructed.
		 
		 
Future revisions of these plans are expected as the Colleges revisit their educational planning needs over the 2025 horizon.  However, the Board of Trustees must approve these facilities master plan revisions and appropriate CEQA review must take place before any deviations from the 2025 plans are implemented. 
		 
The 2025 Master Plans are attached and can be found at the following links.
EVC:
http://www.hmcgroup.com/public/files/EVC%20Master%20Plan-DRAFT_011911-post2.pdf
SJCC:
http://www.hmcgroup.com/public/files/SJCC%20Master%20Plan%20Draft%20011911_post.pdf
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt the 2025 Facilities Master Plans for San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College.

items.item_details: Chancellor Cepeda and Vice Chancellor Hawk will provide a budget update.
Chancellor Cepeda will provide a legislative update.

On an annual basis, the San Jose Evergreen Community College District Foundation reports on its fiscal and programmatic activities.  This item is of special importance for two reasons: The foundation has attempted to function without a director from March 31, 2010, until December 14, 2010, with the interim hire of Heather Saito; and, this annual report is not a retrospective of work undertaken but rather a representation of the revised priorities and directions for the Foundation. This new direction was established by the board as a platform upon which to rebuild the district's image and strengthen the Foundation as a critical resource development avenue for our students and district. Finally, it is important to note that the revitalization of the SJECCD Foundation was established as an important performance objective for the Chancellor.
items.item_text: San Jose Evergreen Community College District Foundation Annual Report
items.item_text_raw: 3. San Jose Evergreen Community College District Foundation Annual Report

items.item_details:
Pursuant to Education Code 84040.3, each organization that is described in Section 501 (c) 3 of the Internal Revenue Code that is recognized by the governing board of a community college district as having a formal relationship with, and that is working on behalf of, the district or a community college within the district, shall file a copy of its audited financial report for the previous fiscal year with the governing board on or before April 1 of each year.
	 
The attached fiscal year 2009-2010 annual financial report for the San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Foundation is  provided for the Board of Trustees' information.

The Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee that is appointed by the Board of Trustees have a responsibility under the provisions of Proposition 39 to inform the public, review expenditures, and present to the board of trustees an annual written report.
	 
The attached CBOC annual report for fiscal year 2009/2010 is presented by Nicholas Dinh, Committee Chair- 2009-2010, as information to the Board of Trustees.
	 
The report is also available for review using the following link:
http://sjebond.maasco.com/uploads/cboc_annual_report_09-10_web.pdf
